nodes.text: Transfect cultured neurons with a form of NGL-2 in which EGFP was tagged to the N terminus (EGFP-NGL-2) at DIV 14, and incubate for 2 days.
Mix 5 μg of biotin-conjugated EGFP antibodies (Rockland) and 2 μL of neutravidin-conjugated FluoSphere beads (Molecular Probes; 1 μm diameter), and incubate for 1 h.
Increase the volume of the mixture to 1 mL by adding Hank’s balanced salt solution (HBSS), and centrifuge at 13,000 rpm for 1 min in a microcentrifuge
Carefully remove the supernatant, and resuspend the precipitates in 100 μL of conditioned media where neurons were growing
Place the coverslips containing transfected neurons (DIV16) face-up on 6-well (or larger) dishes.
Add 100 μL of the resuspended beads onto the neurons and incubate at 37 oC for 30 min.
Wash the neurons twice with HBSS, and place the coverslip back into the culture media
After 24 h of incubation, fix and immunostain the neurons with primary antibodies against various synaptic proteins and fluorophore-conjugated secondary antibodies
Capture Z-stacked images by confocal immunofluorescence microscopy as well as DIC imaging
For quantitation, manually trace the boundaries of the beads. Copy a boundary to a nearby dendritic area for normalization.
An average immunofluorescence intensity of a synaptic marker from a bead area was measured and normalized to that from a nearby control area
